properties.privacy: If true then domain privacy is enabled for this domain
properties.lastRenewedTime: Timestamp when the domain was renewed last time
properties.autoRenew: If true then domain will renewed automatically
properties.readyForDnsRecordManagement: If true then Azure can assign this domain to Web Apps. This value will be true if domain registration status is active and it is hosted on name servers Azure has programmatic access to

managedHostNames.name: Name of the hostname
managedHostNames.azureResourceName: Name of the Azure resource the hostname is assigned to. If it is assigned to a traffic manager then it will be the traffic manager name otherwise it will be the website name
managedHostNames.azureResourceType: Type of the Azure resource the hostname is assigned to

consent.agreedAt: Timestamp when the agreements were accepted

sku.name: (string)
sku.tier: (string)
sku.capacity: (integer)

sku.name: (string)
sku.tier: (string)
sku.capacity: (integer)

sku.name: Name for the App Service Plan SKU
sku.tier: Service Tier for the App Service Plan
sku.capacity: Current number of workers assigned to the App Service Plan

properties.name: Name of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.location: Location of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment), e.g. "West US"
properties.status: Current status of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.vnetName: Name of the hostingEnvironment's (App Service Environment) virtual network
properties.vnetResourceGroupName: Resource group of the hostingEnvironment's (App Service Environment) virtual network
properties.vnetSubnetName: Subnet of the hostingEnvironment's (App Service Environment) virtual network

virtualNetwork.id: Resource id of the virtual network
virtualNetwork.name: Name of the virtual network (read-only)
virtualNetwork.type: Resource type of the virtual network (read-only)

properties.internalLoadBalancingMode: Specifies which endpoints to serve internally in the hostingEnvironment's (App Service Environment) VNET

sku.name: Name for the App Service Plan SKU
sku.tier: Service Tier for the App Service Plan
sku.capacity: Current number of workers assigned to the App Service Plan

properties.workerSizeId: Worker size id for referencing this worker pool
properties.computeMode: Shared or dedicated web app hosting
properties.workerSize: VM size of the worker pool instances
properties.workerCount: Number of instances in the worker pool

properties.ipsslAddressCount: Number of IP SSL addresses reserved for this hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.databaseEdition: Edition of the metadata database for the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment) e.g. "Standard"
properties.databaseServiceObjective: Service objective of the metadata database for the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment) e.g. "S0"
properties.upgradeDomains: Number of upgrade domains of this hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.subscriptionId: Subscription of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.dnsSuffix: DNS suffix of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.lastAction: Last deployment action on this hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.lastActionResult: Result of the last deployment action on this hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.allowedMultiSizes: List of comma separated strings describing which VM sizes are allowed for front-ends
properties.allowedWorkerSizes: List of comma separated strings describing which VM sizes are allowed for workers
properties.maximumNumberOfMachines: Maximum number of VMs in this hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)

environmentCapacities.name: Name of the stamp
environmentCapacities.availableCapacity: Available capacity (# of machines, bytes of storage etc...)
environmentCapacities.totalCapacity: Total capacity (# of machines, bytes of storage etc...)
environmentCapacities.workerSizeId:
Size Id of machines: 
            0 - Small
            1 - Medium
            2 - Large
environmentCapacities.excludeFromCapacityAllocation:
If true it includes basic sites
            Basic sites are not used for capacity allocation.
environmentCapacities.isApplicableForAllComputeModes: Is capacity applicable for all sites?

properties.environmentIsHealthy: True/false indicating whether the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment) is healthy
properties.environmentStatus: Detailed message about with results of the last check of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.resourceGroup: Resource group of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
properties.suspended:
True/false indicating whether the hostingEnvironment is suspended. The environment can be suspended e.g. when the management endpoint is no longer available
            (most likely because NSG blocked the incoming traffic)

properties.serverFarmId: App Service Plan ARM resource ID
properties.name: Name for the App Service Plan
properties.workerSizeId: Size of the compute resources assigned to the App Service Plan
properties.hostingEnvironment:
Name for the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment) hosting this App Service Plan
            Value is Null when hosted on public environment

hostingEnvironmentProfile.id: Resource id of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
hostingEnvironmentProfile.name: Name of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment) (read only)
hostingEnvironmentProfile.type: Resource type of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment) (read only)

properties.maximumNumberOfWorkers: Maximum number of instances that can be assigned to this App Service Plan
properties.geoRegion: Geographical location for the App Service Plan
properties.perSiteScaling:
If True apps assigned to this App Service Plan can be scaled independently
            If False apps assigned to this App Service Plan will scale to all instances of the plan
properties.numberOfSites: Number of web apps assigned to this App Service Plan

sku.name: (string)
sku.tier: (string)
sku.capacity: (integer)

sku.name: Name for the App Service Plan SKU
sku.tier: Service Tier for the App Service Plan
sku.capacity: Current number of workers assigned to the App Service Plan

properties.name: The name of this route. This is only returned by the server and does not need to be set by the client.
properties.startAddress: The starting address for this route. This may also include a CIDR notation, in which case the end address must not be specified.
properties.endAddress: The ending address for this route. If the start address is specified in CIDR notation, this must be omitted.
properties.routeType:
The type of route this is:
            DEFAULT - By default, every web app has routes to the local address ranges specified by RFC1918
            INHERITED - Routes inherited from the real Virtual Network routes
            STATIC - Static route set on the web app only
            
            These values will be used for syncing a Web App's routes with those from a Virtual Network. This operation will clear all DEFAULT and INHERITED routes and replace them
            with new INHERITED routes.

sku.name: (string)
sku.tier: (string)
sku.capacity: (integer)

sku.tier: Service Tier for the App Service Plan
sku.capacity: Current number of workers assigned to the App Service Plan

properties.name: The name of this route. This is only returned by the server and does not need to be set by the client.
properties.startAddress: The starting address for this route. This may also include a CIDR notation, in which case the end address must not be specified.
properties.endAddress: The ending address for this route. If the start address is specified in CIDR notation, this must be omitted.
properties.routeType:
The type of route this is:
            DEFAULT - By default, every web app has routes to the local address ranges specified by RFC1918
            INHERITED - Routes inherited from the real Virtual Network routes
            STATIC - Static route set on the web app only
            
            These values will be used for syncing a Web App's routes with those from a Virtual Network. This operation will clear all DEFAULT and INHERITED routes and replace them
            with new INHERITED routes.

sku.name: (string)
sku.tier: (string)
sku.capacity: (integer)

sku.name: Name for the App Service Plan SKU
sku.tier: Service Tier for the App Service Plan
sku.capacity: Current number of workers assigned to the App Service Plan

properties.name: Name of web app
properties.usageState: State indicating whether web app has exceeded its quota usage
properties.enabled: True if the site is enabled; otherwise, false. Setting this  value to false disables the site (takes the site off line).
properties.availabilityState:
Management information availability state for the web app. Possible values are Normal or Limited. 
            Normal means that the site is running correctly and that management information for the site is available. 
            Limited means that only partial management information for the site is available and that detailed site information is unavailable.

hostNameSslStates.name: Host name
hostNameSslStates.virtualIP: Virtual IP address assigned to the host name if IP based SSL is enabled
hostNameSslStates.toUpdate: Set this flag to update existing host name
hostNameSslStates.toUpdateIpBasedSsl: Set this flag to update existing host name

properties.serverFarm: App service plan web app is assoicated with
properties.lastModifiedTimeUtc: Last time web app was modified in UTC

sku.name: Name for the App Service Plan SKU
sku.tier: Service Tier for the App Service Plan
sku.capacity: Current number of workers assigned to the App Service Plan

handlerMappings.extension: Requests with this extension will be handled using the specified FastCGI application.
handlerMappings.scriptProcessor: The absolute path to the FastCGI application.
handlerMappings.arguments: Command-line arguments to be passed to the script processor.

rampUpRules.actionHostName: Hostname of a slot to which the traffic will be redirected if decided to. E.g. mysite-stage.azurewebsites.net
rampUpRules.reroutePercentage: Percentage of the traffic which will be redirected to {Microsoft.Web.Hosting.Administration.RampUpRule.ActionHostName}
rampUpRules.changeIntervalInMinutes: [Optional] Specifies interval in mimuntes to reevaluate ReroutePercentage
rampUpRules.minReroutePercentage: [Optional] Specifies lower boundary above which ReroutePercentage will stay.
rampUpRules.maxReroutePercentage: [Optional] Specifies upper boundary below which ReroutePercentage will stay.
rampUpRules.changeDecisionCallbackUrl:
Custom decision algorithm can be provided in TiPCallback site extension which Url can be specified. See TiPCallback site extension for the scaffold and contracts.
            https://www.siteextensions.net/packages/TiPCallback/
rampUpRules.name: Name of the routing rule. The recommended name would be to point to the slot which will receive the traffic in the experiment.

limits.maxMemoryInMb: Maximum allowed memory usage in MB
limits.maxDiskSizeInMb: Maximum allowed disk size usage in MB

triggers.privateBytesInKB: PrivateBytesInKB - Defines a rule based on private bytes

actions.actionType: ActionType - predefined action to be taken

siteAuthSettings.clientId: Gets or sets the unique ID of this relying party application, known as the client_id.
siteAuthSettings.issuer:
Gets or sets the OpenID Connect Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this application.
            When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/.
            This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer.

properties.premiumAppDeployed: If set indicates whether web app is deployed as a premium app
properties.scmSiteAlsoStopped: If set indicates whether to stop SCM (KUDU) site when the web app is stopped. Default is false.
properties.targetSwapSlot: Read-only property that specifies which slot this app will swap into
properties.hostingEnvironment: Name of hosting environment (App Service Environment) the web app belongs to

hostingEnvironmentProfile.id: Resource id of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment)
hostingEnvironmentProfile.name: Name of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment) (read only)
hostingEnvironmentProfile.type: Resource type of the hostingEnvironment (App Service Environment) (read only)

properties.gatewaySiteName: Name of gateway app associated with web app
properties.clientAffinityEnabled: Specifies if the client affinity is enabled when load balancing http request for multiple instances of the web app
properties.clientCertEnabled: Specifies if the client certificate is enabled for the web app
properties.outboundIpAddresses: List of comma separated IP addresses that this web app uses for outbound connections. Those can be used when configuring firewall rules for databases accessed by this web app.

cloningInfo.correlationId:
Correlation Id of cloning operation. This id ties multiple cloning operations
            together to use the same snapshot
cloningInfo.cloneCustomHostNames: If true, clone custom hostnames from source web app
cloningInfo.cloneSourceControl: Clone source control from source web app
cloningInfo.sourceWebAppId:
ARM resource id of the source web app. Web app resource id is of the form 
            /subscriptions/{subId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Web/sites/{siteName} for production slots and 
            /subscriptions/{subId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Web/sites/{siteName}/slots/{slotName} for other slots
cloningInfo.trafficManagerProfileId:
ARM resource id of the traffic manager profile to use if it exists. Traffic manager resource id is of the form 
            /subscriptions/{subId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/trafficmanagerprofiles/{profileName}
cloningInfo.trafficManagerProfileName: Name of traffic manager profile to create. This is only needed if traffic manager profile does not already exist

RequestBodyDoc.snapshotTime: Point in time in which the site recover should be attempted.
RequestBodyDoc.siteName: [Optional] Destination web app name into which web app should be recovered. This is case when new web app should be created instead.
RequestBodyDoc.slotName: [Optional] Destination web app slot name into which web app should be recovered

RequestBodyDoc.slotName: [Optional] Destination web app slot name into which web app should be recovered

rampUpRules.maxReroutePercentage: [Optional] Specifies upper boundary below which ReroutePercentage will stay.
rampUpRules.changeDecisionCallbackUrl:
Custom decision algorithm can be provided in TiPCallback site extension which Url can be specified. See TiPCallback site extension for the scaffold and contracts.
            https://www.siteextensions.net/packages/TiPCallback/
rampUpRules.name: Name of the routing rule. The recommended name would be to point to the slot which will receive the traffic in the experiment.

limits.maxMemoryInMb: Maximum allowed memory usage in MB
limits.maxDiskSizeInMb: Maximum allowed disk size usage in MB

triggers.privateBytesInKB: PrivateBytesInKB - Defines a rule based on private bytes

actions.actionType: ActionType - predefined action to be taken

siteAuthSettings.clientId: Gets or sets the unique ID of this relying party application, known as the client_id.
siteAuthSettings.issuer:
Gets or sets the OpenID Connect Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this application.
            When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/.
            This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer.

sku.capacity: (integer)

handlerMappings.extension: Requests with this extension will be handled using the specified FastCGI application.
handlerMappings.scriptProcessor: The absolute path to the FastCGI application.
handlerMappings.arguments: Command-line arguments to be passed to the script processor.

rampUpRules.actionHostName: Hostname of a slot to which the traffic will be redirected if decided to. E.g. mysite-stage.azurewebsites.net
rampUpRules.reroutePercentage: Percentage of the traffic which will be redirected to {Microsoft.Web.Hosting.Administration.RampUpRule.ActionHostName}
rampUpRules.changeIntervalInMinutes: [Optional] Specifies interval in mimuntes to reevaluate ReroutePercentage
rampUpRules.minReroutePercentage: [Optional] Specifies lower boundary above which ReroutePercentage will stay.
rampUpRules.maxReroutePercentage: [Optional] Specifies upper boundary below which ReroutePercentage will stay.
rampUpRules.changeDecisionCallbackUrl:
Custom decision algorithm can be provided in TiPCallback site extension which Url can be specified. See TiPCallback site extension for the scaffold and contracts.
            https://www.siteextensions.net/packages/TiPCallback/
rampUpRules.name: Name of the routing rule. The recommended name would be to point to the slot which will receive the traffic in the experiment.

limits.maxMemoryInMb: Maximum allowed memory usage in MB
limits.maxDiskSizeInMb: Maximum allowed disk size usage in MB

siteAuthSettings.issuer:
Gets or sets the OpenID Connect Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this application.
            When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/.
            This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer.

azureTableStorage.sasUrl: SAS url to an azure table with add/query/delete permissions

azureBlobStorage.sasUrl: SAS url to a azure blob container with read/write/list/delete permissions
azureBlobStorage.retentionInDays:
Retention in days.
            Remove blobs older than X days.
            0 or lower means no retention.

fileSystem.retentionInMb:
Maximum size in megabytes that http log files can use.
            When reached old log files will be removed to make space for new ones.
            Value can range between 25 and 100.

            Remove files older than X days.
            0 or lower means no retention.
